title: Taking the Pledge for One Less Straw - Mission Blue
body: That is like 1.6 straws for every man, woman and child living in this country… every single day. If you were to take an entire day's worth of plastic straws we use in one day, it would fill up over 127 school busses. That is like over 46,400 school buses full of one-time use plastic straws that are ending up in our landfills and waterways.
readable_content:
Mission Blue Annual Report (2023)
- Rose Ballsi (2016-09-13): fantastic idea! Let’s unite together for mother earth!! Can’t say when the last time I used a straw. Years ago!!
- Lyza Ingkiriwang (2016-08-28): you both are awesome!!
- Patricia Tricorache (2016-08-27): How about starting a contest for the best ideas to reuse straws? Could be a handcraft or something useful.
- Olivia and Carter Ries (2016-08-25): Thank you all so much for the amazing support. We are so honored to be working with you and look forward to tackling plastic straws together.
summary: The comments reflect overwhelming support and enthusiasm for the idea of tackling plastic straw use. People are expressing their excitement and willingness to be a part of the movement, with suggestions for creative solutions and appreciation for the initiative. Overall, the sentiment is extremely positive. Sentiment: 0.9
